briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate a Modified RNA Vaccine Against Influenza in Adults 18 Years of Age or Older
officialTitle: A PHASE 3, RANDOMIZED, OBSERVER-BLINDED STUDY TO EVALUATE THE EFFICACY, SAFETY, TOLERABILITY, AND IMMUNOGENICITY OF A MODIFIED RNA VACCINE AGAINST INFLUENZA COMPARED TO LICENSED INACTIVATED INFLUENZA VACCINE IN HEALTHY ADULTS 18 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER

arms.label: Quadrivalent influenza modRNA vaccine, 18 through 64 years of age
Quadrivalent influenza vaccine, 18 through 64 years of age
Quadrivalent influenza modRNA vaccine, ≥65 years of age
Quadrivalent influenza vaccine, ≥65 years of age

summary: This is a Phase 3, randomized, observer-blinded study to evaluate the efficacy, safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of a single dose of a quadrivalent influenza modRNA vaccine compared to licensed inactivated influenza vaccine in healthy adults 18 years of age and older.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting First Episode of LCI Cases With Associated Per-Protocol ILI Caused by Any Strain at Least 14 Days After Vaccination: 18-64 Years
